FuncDef:
The server command adds a server to a DHCPv6 relay server group.
The undo server command deletes a specified or all servers from a DHCPv6 relay server group.
By default, a DHCPv6 relay server group does not have any server.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the IPv6 address of a DHCPv6 relay server.
The value is a 32-digit hexadecimal number, in the format of X:X:X:X:X:X:X:X.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To add a server to a DHCPv6 relay server group, run the server command.
Prerequisites
A DHCPv6 relay server group has been configured using the dhcpv6 relay server group command in the system view.
Precautions
A maximum of 20 servers can be added to a DHCPv6 relay server group.
A server can be added to different DHCPv6 relay server groups.
